title: How to Be Pro at Halo Blood Gulch Race

steps.headline: Open Halo (Trial if you have it).
Join a game with the Game type 'Race' and in Blood Gulch.
Make sure it is low on Ping to reduce lag, for higher Warthog steadiness and performance.
Run towards a Warthog (not rocket ones, they are slower) and enter it immediately if it is a new game.
steps.description: If it has already started, just enjoy yourself until the game restarts.

steps.headline: Concentrate hard on your driving and watch out for rocks and obstacles in the way.
Do the right turn using the help of the little slanted ground as seen in the picture if you started the Race from the direction the Warthog came from in the picture.
Go pass the second checkpoint, it is better to go through it from the right side of the base.
Go to the third checkpoint and watch out for rocks, sharp hills, ridges and opponents’ cars.
Do a turn around on the rock next to the third checkpoint as shown in the picture.
Follow the route that goes up the big hill to prevent ridges on the ground.
steps.description: The alternate route is to go up the ridge! Once you are on the ridge, turn left a bit immediately, not too much. Making a mistake here might cause you to fall off your Warthog.

steps.headline: Drive through the left side of the rock in front and turn left for the fourth checkpoint.
steps.description: This is one of the hardest bit (if you don’t want to fall off). Do not aim your Warthog on the narrow path but aim it on the edge of the wall.

steps.headline: Drive as fast as you can when you reach the place the Warthog is at in the picture.
steps.description: Then crash at the highlighted area as shown and the Warthog would naturally fly off to the left side and land upright without falling off it.

steps.headline: Drive to the fifth checkpoint up on the cliff.
steps.description: Do not drive on the path up the cliff but go up the side of the cliff.

steps.headline: Keep driving on the cliff until you are just about to touch the fifth checkpoint.
steps.description: At that point, turn left for more than 90° as quickly as possible. Be careful not to turn too much, passing 180°. The Warthog should spin in mid air, like when a helicopter spins automatically when the engine is down.

steps.headline: Point to the direction of the side (90°) of the Warthog that is closer to the ground when it is about to touch the ground (if the Warthog tilted onto one side).
steps.description: Once the Warthog is back upright, reach the final checkpoint to complete your lap.

text: Open Halo (Trial if you have it).  Join a game with the Game type 'Race' and in Blood Gulch.  Make sure it is low on Ping to reduce lag, for higher Warthog steadiness and performance.  Run towards a Warthog (not rocket ones, they are slower) and enter it immediately if it is a new game. If it has already started, just enjoy yourself until the game restarts. Concentrate hard on your driving and watch out for rocks and obstacles in the way.  Do the right turn using the help of the little slanted ground as seen in the picture if you started the Race from the direction the Warthog came from in the picture.  Go pass the second checkpoint, it is better to go through it from the right side of the base.  Go to the third checkpoint and watch out for rocks, sharp hills, ridges and opponents’ cars.  Do a turn around on the rock next to the third checkpoint as shown in the picture.  Follow the route that goes up the big hill to prevent ridges on the ground. The alternate route is to go up the ridge! Once you are on the ridge, turn left a bit immediately, not too much. Making a mistake here might cause you to fall off your Warthog. Drive through the left side of the rock in front and turn left for the fourth checkpoint. This is one of the hardest bit (if you don’t want to fall off). Do not aim your Warthog on the narrow path but aim it on the edge of the wall. Drive as fast as you can when you reach the place the Warthog is at in the picture. Then crash at the highlighted area as shown and the Warthog would naturally fly off to the left side and land upright without falling off it. Drive to the fifth checkpoint up on the cliff. Do not drive on the path up the cliff but go up the side of the cliff. Keep driving on the cliff until you are just about to touch the fifth checkpoint. At that point, turn left for more than 90° as quickly as possible. Be careful not to turn too much, passing 180°. The Warthog should spin in mid air, like when a helicopter spins automatically when the engine is down. Point to the direction of the side (90°) of the Warthog that is closer to the ground when it is about to touch the ground (if the Warthog tilted onto one side). Once the Warthog is back upright, reach the final checkpoint to complete your lap.
